meanings.definition: Make a series of short explosive spitting or choking sounds.
meanings.sent1: The old car splutters when it tries to start.
meanings.sent2: The kettle splutters as it comes to a boil.
meanings.sent3: The baby found it funny when the toy robot splutters.
meanings.sent4: The campfire splutters as the rain starts to fall.
meanings.sent5: The engine splutters before finally starting up.

meanings.definition: Utter in a series of short explosive spitting or choking sounds.
meanings.sent1: She splutters her words when she gets too excited.
meanings.sent2: The comedian splutters out his punchline, making everyone laugh.
meanings.sent3: The cat splutters its displeasure at being given a bath.
meanings.sent4: The radio splutters the news in a garbled manner.
meanings.sent5: The toddler splutters out a song with enthusiasm.
